page.title: 14Local employment
page.content: The main industry is farming which covers cereal growing and cattle and sheep rearing, also a vineyard with associated wine cellar, turf growing for domestic gardens and a turkey farm which includes a farm shop selling fresh and frozen meat. A supplier of yachting equipment is housed in an old mill next to the railway station, and various ropes and chains are visible from the roadway. Close to the reservoir is a workshop which at present is partly occupied by a firm undertaking kitchen and bedroom decor, while the remaining part is advertised to let. Tourism is an important factor, hence three popular pubs all serving food, and ample car parking with picnic areas and public toilets at the reservoir and at Abbots Wood where an ice cream van is usually present on summer afternoons.
